headline: Tesla, Sunrun hail ‘win-win for the household and the grid’ with California virtual power plant test
summary_80w: A 535MW fleet of aggregated household battery storage systems, including Tesla Powerwalls, effectively reduced net load on the California grid in a recent test event.

headline: Illuminate USA to acquire US-made solar glass from Solarcycle
summary_80w: Illuminate USA has signed a five-year deal with US panel recycling firm Solarcycle to acquire solar glass manufactured in the US.

headline: UVID is ‘particularly concerning’ for TOPCon cells – UNSW
summary_80w: Greater awareness of UV light used to test solar cells could result in faster, more efficient assessments of long-term performance.

headline: European solar buyers’ confidence falls in July 2025
summary_80w: European solar buyers’ confidence fell to a record low level in July 2025 due to 'caution among buyers' in a more ' volatile' environment.

headline: US Commerce initiates AD/CVD investigation on Indian, Indonesian and Laos solar cells
summary_80w: The US Department of Commerce has initiated an antidumping duty and countervailing duty investigations of crystalline silicon PV cells, whether or not assembled into modules from India, Indonesia, and Laos.

headline: Exus Renewables, MUFG close financing on 130MW Portugal PV plant
summary_80w: Spain-based renewable energy firm Exus Renewables has closed financing on a 130MW solar PV project in Portugal.

headline: Belectric powers 96MW Germany PV plant, plans storage addition
summary_80w: German renewables engineering firm Belectric has begun operations at a 96MW solar PV project near its headquarters in the Kolitzheim area of Germany.

headline: Winda Energy building 30MW/60MWh BESS in Finland with European suppliers
summary_80w: Developer Winda Energy will put a 30MW/60MWh BESS in Finland into operation next year, built with technology supplied by European companies.

headline: Risen Energy: Reliable, efficient energy storage from a trusted global name
summary_80w: One of the world’s major players in solar PV is also becoming a well-known name in the energy storage system (ESS) space.

headline: Energy Vault acquires 1GWh BESS in Australia as Q2 2025 revenue increases by 125% year-on-year
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and system integrator Energy Vault has acquired the 125MW/1,000MWh Stoney Creek BESS in New South Wales, Australia.

headline: Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 6 to ‘open soon’, seeking 2.4GWh of energy storage in Western Australia
summary_80w: Australia’s AusEnergy Services (ASL), formerly AEMO Services, has released the Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) Tender 6 parameters, seeking an initial 2,400MWh of dispatchable capacity in Western Australia.

headline: Caterpillar signs deal for CHP plant with 1.1GWh integrated BESS at data centre campus in Utah
summary_80w: Caterpillar has agreed to deploy a CHP plant featuring more than a gigawatt-hour of batteries for a new data centre complex in Utah, US.

headline: Ampyr Australia starts construction on 600MWh BESS in New South Wales
summary_80w: Ampyr Australia has officially started construction on its 300MW/600MWh Wellington Stage 1 BESS in New South Wales.

headline: FINANCING ROUND-UP: CREC, BRUC, Qair and Greenalia secure funds for projects
summary_80w: This week several solar developers have raised funds for projects around the world, including BRUC in Europe, Greenalia in the US, Qair in Mauritius and CREC in Philippines.

headline: US market, slow residential demand impact SMA Solar H1 2025 results
summary_80w: German solar inverter manufacturer SMA Solar posted losses in the first half of 2025, as demand in the residential and corporate & industrial (C&I) solar sectors 'remains weak'.

headline: Array Technologies posts revenue of US$362.2 million in Q2 2025
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Array Technologies has posted revenue of US$362.2 million in the second quarter of this year.

headline: ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ Act brings changes, some clarity to US energy storage development
summary_80w: Energy storage escaped much of the pain inflicted on solar, but foreign entity restrictions may create some supply-chain challenges.

headline: ‘A win for Transatlantic relations’ but a ‘big loss’ for creditors: Lyten’s Northvolt deal
summary_80w: Lyten's deal to acquire and recommence operations of European battery firm Northvolt out of bankruptcy has winners and losers, but some of the challenges that led to its demise have already been solved.

headline: Indiana county officials reject 800MWh LFP BESS proposal, despite MISO capacity warnings
summary_80w: Officials at the Zoning Board of Appeals for Hamilton County, Indiana, have rejected an application for a lithium iron phosphate BESS from developer Aypa Power.

headline: Portland General Electric completes over 1.9GWh of BESS projects in Oregon
summary_80w: Utility Portland General Electric (PGE) announced the completion of three battery energy storage systems (BESS) totalling more than 1.9GWh in Portland, Oregon, US.
